title: Pork Tenderloin with Whiskey Honey Sauce

ingredients.content: 20 - 24 oz pork tenderloin, halved to fit Varoma
¼ tsp ground black pepper, divided
7 oz fennel bulb, halved, cored, sliced (¼ in.)
5 oz red onions, halved, sliced (¼ in.)
1 Pink Lady apple, halved, cored, sliced (½ in.)
4 oz unsalted butter, cut into pieces

preparations.content: Place Varoma dish into position, weigh in pork tenderloin, season with ¼ tsp salt and ⅛ tsp pepper. Insert Varoma tray and weigh in fennel, onions and apple and set Varoma aside.

Place water, butter, honey, whiskey, flour, mustard, ¼ tsp salt, stock paste and ⅛ tsp pepper into mixing bowl. Place Varoma dish without Varoma tray into position, secure Varoma lid and steam <b>12 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>.
Carefully open Varoma lid, insert Varoma tray with vegetables and apple, secure Varoma lid and steam a further <b>13 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>.
Arrange dandelion leaves on a serving platter. Slice pork into medallions (approx. ½ in.). Transfer pork medallions and fennel mixture on top of greens and drizzle sauce over pork. Serve immediately.

hintsAndTricks: For firmer vegetables and apples, insert Varoma tray during the last 8-10 minutes of steaming.
The USDA Guidelines and National Pork Board recommend cooking pork chops, roasts and tenderloin to an internal temperature between 145°F (medium rare) and 160°F (medium), followed by a 3 minute rest.
